channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Three murder arrests over boy's river death in Bridgend
item.description: A 13-year-old boy and two adults are arrested on suspicion of murder after a child's body was found.

item.title: Abergele holiday park incident: Man held as girl, 15, dies
item.description: A 15-year-old girl dies and a 19-year-old man has been arrested after the incident on Saturday.

item.title: Coin marks 150 years since Alice in Wonderland sequel
item.description: The Alice in Wonderland themed £5 coin celebrates 150 years since Lewis Carroll's famous tales.

item.title: Disability: Paralysed woman to swim English Channel
item.description: Paula Craig, 58, is one of a relay team aiming to complete the 21-mile swim to France.

item.title: Wales weather warning: Thunderstorms set to hit south-east Wales
item.description: The yellow warning could see lightning strikes and heavy rain damaging homes, the Met Office says.

item.title: Coronavirus: First people arriving into UK after rules relaxed for fully jabbed
item.description: People vaccinated in the EU or US do not need to isolate when coming to the UK from an amber country.

item.title: Person dies following early morning crash in Swansea
item.description: Police are appealing for witnesses to the single-vehicle crash which happened just before 04:00 BST.

item.title: Cardiff Airport: New flight service to Edinburgh to start
item.description: They will be the first flights linking Cardiff and Edinburgh since Flybe collapsed last year.

item.title: Woman, 80, found clinging to branch in river rescued
item.description: The 80-year-old woman was treated by paramedics at the scene before being taken to hospital.

item.title: Light winds delay Mills' gold meal push
item.description: Great Britain's hopes of sailing medals will have to wait after Monday's action is postponed because of light winds.

item.title: Covid: No incentives for youth vaccine uptake in Wales
item.description: Young people In England, however, are to get travel and takeaway discounts for taking up a jab offer.

item.title: Russell Martin: MK Dons manager named Swansea City head coach
item.description: Swansea City name MK Dons manager Russell Martin as their new head coach.

item.title: Paralysed swimmer Paula Craig in English Channel record bid
item.description: Paula Craig was paralysed after being hit by a car in 2001 - now she aims to swim the Channel.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Hannah Mills and Eilidh McIntyre 'sick with nerves' in chase for sailing gold
item.description: Olympic champion Hannah Mills says she and partner Eilidh McIntyre have been "feeling sick with nerves every single day" as they go for gold in the women's 470 sailing.

item.title: Mobo: Welsh music of black origin project started to 'help give back'
item.description: The new project will allow five singers and producers to be mentored by music professionals.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Talking Books Wales: How one woman helped so many blind people read
item.description: After losing her sight in her 30s, Rhian Evans says she "used that disability" to help others.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain women and men progress in team pursuit
item.description: Great Britain progress in the women's and men's team pursuit as the track cycling gets under way at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Lions braced for Gatland's 'notorious' changes for series decider
item.description: The British and Irish Lions will be a different beast in the South Africa series decider, Alun Wyn Jones warns.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Germany smash world record as GB finish second fastest in women's team pursuit
item.description: Watch as Germany smash the women's team pursuit world record while Great Britain finish second fastest in qualifying.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team eventing gold for GB while Laura Kenny and Laura Muir progress
item.description: Great Britain win a first Olympic team eventing gold since 1972 while the women's team pursuit gets off to a promising start.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh duo Jake Heyward and Joe Brier prepare for Olympics debut
item.description: Welsh duo Jake Heyward and Joe Brier prepare to make their for Olympics debut this week in Tokyo.

item.title: Arestio tri ar amheuaeth o lofruddiaeth ar ôl marwolaeth bachgen
item.description: Tri o bobl wedi'u harestio ar amheuaeth o lofruddiaeth ar ôl i fachgen 5 oed gael ei ganfod yn farw yn Afon Ogwr.

item.title: 'Mwy o gymorth i eisteddfodau bach yn y dyfodol'
item.description: Awgrym y bydd mwy o gefnogaeth i eisteddfodau lleol yn y dyfodol i ddelio â gofynion newydd.

item.title: Rhybudd melyn am stormydd i dde Cymru
item.description: Dywedodd y Swyddfa Dywydd bod perygl y gallai cawodydd trwm o law achosi llifogydd ac oedi i deithwyr.

item.title: Oriel: Gig Eisteddfod Gudd
item.description: Blas o benwythnos o gerddoriaeth fyw wnaeth agor yr Eisteddfod AmGen.

item.title: Abertawe yn penodi Russell Martin yn brif hyfforddwr
item.description: Yr Elyrch wedi penodi cyn-reolwr MK Dons yn dilyn ymadawiad Steve Cooper.
